theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures movement from periphery to core but lacks key community dynamics. Adding legitimate peripheral participation and boundary objects will better represent how newcomers become integrated into the community through gradual engagement and shared artifacts.

variables.name: Legitimate Peripheral Participation Rate
variables.description: Rate at which newcomers engage in simple, low-risk community activities that provide learning opportunities

variables.name: Community Boundary Objects
variables.description: Shared artifacts like code examples, templates, and standard practices that enable coordination between different participation levels

variables.name: Community Engagement Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of community practices in facilitating newcomer integration and learning

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The current model has implicit and explicit knowledge but misses the complete knowledge spiral. Adding socialization spaces and internalization processes will capture how tacit knowledge becomes explicit and gets re-absorbed, creating a continuous knowledge creation cycle essential for community sustainability.

variables.name: Socialization Spaces
variables.description: Opportunities for tacit knowledge sharing through informal interactions, pair programming, and community events

variables.name: Knowledge Internalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge is absorbed and converted into individual tacit knowledge and skills

variables.name: Knowledge Externalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of converting tacit knowledge into explicit, shareable forms
